category.name: Aptitude
category.description: Develop mathematical reasoning and problem-solving skills for competitive exams and interviews.

sub_categories.name: Arithmetic
sub_categories.description: Master arithmetic operations, number theory, and mathematical problem-solving techniques.

exercises.title: Basic Operations
exercises.description: Master fundamental arithmetic operations and number properties.

tasks.title: Calculator Implementation
tasks.question:
Create a basic calculator that performs arithmetic operations.

Your calculator should:

  • Accept two numbers and an operation (+, -, *, /)
  • Perform the specified arithmetic operation
  • Handle division by zero and invalid operations
  • Return results with proper precision
  • Support decimal numbers
tasks.hint: Use switch statements for operations, handle division by zero, and format output

tasks.title: Order of Operations
tasks.question:
What is the result of 2 + 3 ร 4 - 1?

Consider: PEMDAS (Parentheses, Exponents, Multiplication/Division, Addition/Subtraction)
tasks.hint: Follow the order of operations: multiplication first, then addition and subtraction

tasks.title: Number Properties Checker
tasks.question:
Write a function to check various number properties.

Your function should:

  • Check if a number is even or odd
  • Determine if a number is positive, negative, or zero
  • Check if a number is a perfect square
  • Find the absolute value
  • Return all properties in a structured format
tasks.hint: Use modulo for even/odd, comparison for sign, and square root for perfect square check
tasks.output: Even: true, Positive: true, Perfect Square: true, Absolute: 16

exercises.title: Fractions and Decimals
exercises.description: Work with fractions, decimals, and their conversions.

tasks.title: Fraction Calculator
tasks.question:
Implement a fraction calculator for basic operations.

Your calculator should:

  • Add, subtract, multiply, and divide fractions
  • Simplify fractions to lowest terms
  • Convert between fractions and decimals
  • Handle mixed numbers
  • Return results in simplified form
tasks.hint: Use GCD for simplification, cross-multiplication for addition/subtraction, and proper fraction arithmetic

tasks.title: Fraction to Decimal
tasks.question:
What is the decimal equivalent of 3/8?

Consider: Divide numerator by denominator

tasks.title: Decimal to Fraction Converter
tasks.question:
Create a function to convert decimals to fractions.

Your function should:

  • Convert terminating decimals to fractions
  • Handle repeating decimals (basic cases)
  • Simplify the resulting fraction
  • Support decimal precision up to 4 places
  • Return the fraction in lowest terms
tasks.hint: Multiply by power of 10 to eliminate decimal, then simplify using GCD
